Package cse222.gtu

Class FileSystem

java.lang.Object
cse222.gtu.FileSystem
public class FileSystem extends Object
FileSystem represents a simple file system with directories and files. It provides functionalities to create, delete, move, and list directories and files.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FileSystem()
    Constructs a new FileSystem with a root directory.

    • createFile

      public void createFile(String name, Directory parent)
      Creates a new file with the given name and adds it to the specified parent directory.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the file to be created
      parent - the parent directory where the file will be created

    • createDirectory

      public void createDirectory(String name, Directory parent)
      Creates a new directory with the given name and adds it to the specified parent directory.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the directory to be created
      parent - the parent directory where the directory will be created

    • deleteFile

      public void deleteFile(String name, Directory parent)
      Deletes the file with the given name from the specified parent directory.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the file to be deleted
      parent - the parent directory from which the file will be deleted

    • deleteDirectory

      public void deleteDirectory(String name, Directory parent)
      Deletes the directory with the given name from the specified parent directory.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the directory to be deleted
      parent - the parent directory from which the directory will be deleted

    • moveElement

      public void moveElement(String name, String path, Directory parent)
      Moves the file or directory with the given name to the specified path. If the destination directory does not exist, the element remains in its original location.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the file or directory to be moved
      path - the destination path to which the file or directory will be moved
      parent - the parent directory from which the file or directory will be moved

    • search

      public boolean search(String name, Directory parent)
      Searches for an element (file or directory) with the given name within the specified parent directory.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the element to search for
      parent - the parent directory in which the search will be conducted
      Returns:
      true if the element is found, false otherwise

    • searchRecursive

      public FileSystemElement searchRecursive(String name, Directory parent)
      Recursively searches for an element (file or directory) with the given name within the specified parent directory.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the element to search for
      parent - the parent directory in which the recursive search will be conducted
      Returns:
      the found element if it exists, null otherwise

    • printDirectoryTree

      public void printDirectoryTree(Directory currentDirectory)
      Prints the directory tree structure starting from the specified directory.
      Parameters:
      currentDirectory - the directory from which the directory tree will be printed

    • listContents

      public void listContents(Directory dir)
      Lists the contents (files and directories) of the specified directory.
      Parameters:
      dir - the directory whose contents will be listed

    • sortDirectoryByDate

      public void sortDirectoryByDate(Directory dir)
      Sorts the contents of the specified directory by date created and prints them.
      Parameters:
      dir - the directory whose contents will be sorted and printed

    • getCurrentPath

      public String getCurrentPath(FileSystemElement element)
      Constructs and returns the current path of the given FileSystemElement.
      Parameters:
      element - the file or directory whose path will be constructed
      Returns:
      the current path of the element

    • changeDirectory

      public Directory changeDirectory(String path)
      Changes the current directory to the one specified by the given path.
      Parameters:
      path - the path of the directory to change to
      Returns:
      the new current directory if the change is successful, null otherwise

    • getRoot

      public Directory getRoot()
      Returns the root directory of the file system.
      Returns:
      the root directory
